column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Found it is very important to wash all the parts to this medicine or the medicine will come out under the tip and waste. Had bleeding for over a month using it 2 times daily. Went up to 3x daily and it stopped the bleeding in 1 day.

column2: DJven, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: If you have hemroids don't bother with Preparation H. I have found nothing over-the-counter that works. Proctofoam HC shrinks/heals hemroids if used properly. It is, however OUTRAGEOUSLY EXPENSIVE. I cannot imagine why one little cortesone foam dispenser should cost $75-$100 or more.

column9: I recently developed hemorrhoids and my doctor prescribed this drug.  It is somewhat effective but VERY EXPENSIVE!  Also, foam constantly  leaks out of the applicator wasting it. I called the company but they were not helpful in replacing the drug.  I contacted my doctor and my health organization to complain about the poor dosage delivery. UNACCEPTABLE AND EXPENSIVE TOO!!

column2: jj, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After giving birth I developed hemorrhoids. Although I still have them, this medication has made me more comfortable. It has a numbing sensation and soothes the area. My only complaint is that the foam sometimes leaks out of the applicator wasting it. It was also expensive, even with insurance. But it has provided some much need relief.

column2: jack2700, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Medication is expensive and not much more effective when you use the same medication over-the-counter in a cream or ointment.  The number of uses you get from a 10g canister is inconsistence...I got ~25 uses from one canister and only 10 from another.  I contacted the makers customer service about the normal number of uses and never got a reply.  If they can't answer a simple question then they won't get my money.

column2: jack2700, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The product works fine but is very expensive.  I've found the two active ingredients over the counter which I can easily combine and apply, works as effectually and costs 1/5th the price.

column9: My first minor internal hemeriod. The whole area was itching and waking me at night. This drug was immediate relief with a slight numbing effect. Love it so far. 1st application before bed, let's see how this works. If your itchy or burning, this works

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Proctofoam twice a day for three weeks and have experienced virtually NO relief - I'm still uncomfortable, going to the bathroom is still a painful process, and the area is still highly inflamed.   Like 'tiny dancer,' who reviewed above, I have very painful hemorrhoids as well as an anal fistula that leaves me feeling pain all of the time. I dread going to the bathroom and I almost always bleed, even several minutes following. After such great reviews of Proctofoam I was hoping for better results.
